message: Pulse news reader
angry birds?
skymap
InstaFetch Pro (integrates with InstaPaper for saving and reading web pages on other devices)
evernote, dropbox, shazam, locus, layar, etc.
ES File Explorer, SwitchPro, Skype, ROM Manager (for rooted) and Sanity

Aldiko (eBook reader), Assist (dribbble viewer), dropbox, Hard Copy Pro (another Instapaper app), picplz (like instagram but cross-platform), and of course Google Voice, since I no longer have to pay for a txt plan

I really like Google Talk for quick chats with friends, InstaFetch for saving thing to Instapaper, the official Twitter app, Retro Camera as an alternative camera app, Irssi Connectbot for working on my server and BitMPC to control my music at home.
Astrid (to do app).
pretty sweet to be able to stream any video/audio via vlc, over 3g
VLC S&C
quality is impressive
@Ledlow +1 for picplz. That's a fun app.
Google Reader. I'm an RSS addict.
@dustdaughter Astrid doesn't do it for me. I just shortcut to in-browser Google Tasks.
@dustdaughter To do lists becomes annoying to me when I have to look in a special place to access it. Keeping it in Gmail makes life easy.
@geekwhisperer I wish I could sync it across platforms but other than that it does what I need it to do.
Google Listen for podcasts, and NPR for regular news summaries

Podcasts: Google Listen
Twitter: TweetDeck
Facebook: Facebook
Convore: Convorsation
SSH: ConnectBot
Fitness: RunKeeper
Time Keeping: Toggl
Amazon Cloud Player.  Now if it just had Last.fm integration and a way to listen to podcasts, it would be perfect.
I LOVE the winamp music player. It's worked really well for me so far.
also, agreed about convorsation.
Oh and Read It Later Pro - http://j.mp/eVdFuK
Go Launcher EX (http://j.mp/i52Hev), Go SMS Pro (http://j.mp/ghZDj1) and Rdio (http://j.mp/elvS09)
@akrito I'm constantly using Rdio as well. I like the service, but I wouldn't say the app itself is good.
